intro: Osmorhiza berteroi, commonly known as California boneset, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and streamside habitats. Its root system is fibrous and has been used traditionally by Native American tribes for medicinal purposes.
